summary: Email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing the submission of a detention-related document and a decision not to show photographs to a judge. The emails coordinate review of a draft and note the judge's chambers declined to view photos.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Signatory at the end of the email chain, identified as working in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Detention Submission Preparation
events.description: Prosecution team discusses and prepares a detention submission document for Jeffrey Epstein's case.

events.title: Judge Declines to View Photos
events.description: A prosecutor speaks with the judge's chambers and is told the judge does not want to see photographs, so they are not brought to chambers.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated July 16, 2019, among personnel from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The team is coordinating the review of a draft detention submission document related to Jeffrey Epstein.
A prosecutor communicated with the judge's chambers and was informed the judge did not want to see photographs, with no explanation provided.
The correspondence shows internal prosecution workflow and a specific procedural decision regarding evidence presentation.
